page.title: 04Bramley Grange Hotel
page.content: The Bramley Grange was founded in 1914. It was converted from a manor house and small farm. There are approximately 106 rooms and they have a putting green, lawn tennis and croquet. They are building an indoor pool, a gym, a sauna, a jacussi and 20-30 more bedrooms with colour televisions, telephones and private bathroom facilities. They allow reception parties to be held there and the restaurant is open to non residents. The people who stay there are usually executives working in this area, tourists, people who have been working abroad and are moving into this area, and parents of students visiting particularly Rikkyo School, a Japanese school South of this area.
